reviews.review_msg: I'm a ling major and I took this class in my last semester for an LD credit I needed.  Much of Cliff's theories seemed incorrect. I was taught very contradictory things in this class than I had learned in 200, and 300 level classes. Go to class and memorize his opinion and you'll do fine, but expect to learn drastically different things elsewhere.

Cliff is a great prof! His passion for linguistics is clear in his interactive lectures. He is very caring and he makes each class interesting. However, this is not a "gpa booster" class. He is a fair but tough marker - you need a thorough understanding of the material to do well. Would recommend if you're passionate about linguistics.
so hard....

Engaging, funny and caring. He gives you everything you need to pass, responds to e-mails and will always help you in office hours. He gives you everything you need to get a good grade but you have to work for it

Really recommend this class. Wish I'd taken the grammar class with him too. He records lectures so it's really helpful for review. Also gives midterms back; great for review. Best prof I had this semester. Makes the long lectures less boring too. Also has a lot of office hours for help. Will make sure everything is fair for his students.
Really great- he explained everything clearly, was very helpful answering questions, and made some of the more boring material interesting.

This prof loves the material. His multiple choice questions are very hard and you have to study a lot for this class. If you do not want to go on with linguistics I wouldnt recommend this class. There are other ones which are easier...
Hardest final exam i've ever taken so far at SFU

Hardest multiple choice exams imaginable. Lots of material that goes off in all directions, including the way the mouth makes sounds, and the symbols for those sounds. It's a hodgepodge of all kinds of stuff, and memorizing the material won't cut it. You need to understand it and apply it in the exam. Very tough. You've been warned.
hard to get a good grade on his exams, all MC questions.

Overall, the course is easy and his exams are fair. Lectures can sometimes get boring because he can go on about topics that are unrelated to the lecture but are related to Linguistics. He makes "dad" or "old man" jokes that can sometimes be funny but can also be received as lame by some.

Although the class is whooping 3-hours long is an really easy credit. It requires memorization but everything that he tests you on exams are basically similar questions from the weekly quizzes. It can be boring, but he does try his best to make the class interesting. My savior for the class was my merriam-webster's dictionary app! invest in it!
Attend Lectures/Listen. Read Notes and use textbook where the lecture notes cover. You will do fine. People who complain obviously do not study. Overall, this class is not too bad

You have to read the whole textbook in order to get a good mark. The 1st MT was hard but the 2nd one became easier. I got a D on MT1, an A- on MT2, and a B on the final. THIS COURSE IS NOT A GPA BOOSTER.

There is no problem with the prof, its the content of this course may be very dry and tricky for people with out any knowledge of how words are formed. Not a GPA booster definitely, but if you have a high level of attention to detail, than go for it

He is very passionate about ling but this is a 100 level class we do not need this amount useless info. His MT are so head i just sat there and failed, his finals are okay but still very difficult. IF you are looking for a GPA booster this is not the professor you want.
good prof.. very funny... quizzes are okay.. hard exams though, but he does do review.. not a bad prof, you can tell he cares

Very knowledgeable in the material of LING110. Has his own sense of humor, but kind of dry lecture! MT questions are hard. Has preference on those hard ones. Class avg. improves on 2nd MT. Enjoy his Word-of-the-day and learn some cool words! Overall, I like this prof, but I hope he can cut down some useless & confusing lines in lecture slides.

The Professor has great passion for the course.But neither his lecture is well organized nor the slides context are expressed clearly. The lecture slides are too detailed and complicated. If you are an International student from China as me and seeking a GPA Booster, you would better not choose this professor in ling110.

I noticed he can be really rude when speaking with students including myself. Not a good trait for someone who is supposed to be teaching. He blabbers but not enough clear info, and he makes frequent mitakes which is ok to an extent but not that much.

His class is easy....if you do the work. He is pleasant....if you pay attention and show respect. Basically, you get from it what you put into it, simple as that. He is definitely one of my favourite professors!

Come on man! This is just a 100 level class and he makes it likes a 400 level one. Mid- term is extremely tough, final seems better but it's still not that easy. He especially likes to go to the back of the class and ask students questions, so bear in mind not to fall asleep in lecture otherwise you will be embarrassed.

Burgess has a dry sense of humor and I personally find him boring. I took this class thinking it would be easy and interesting but I stand corrected. I found the midterms and final exam to be quite difficult considering this is only a first year class. Overall, I feel that I didn't get much out of this class. Boring material and boring prof.

disagree with the previous  comment, his final was fair,attend lectures&review the midterms, final is not that hard.you can tell he is really knowledgeable and passionate about what he's teaching. very helpful at office hour, doesn't just tell you the answer but rather teach you the process of solving it.has a different sense of humor, i like him.
He is a helpful prof but not an easy course.
No Comments
Not helpful at all. Tries to be funny, but his arrogant style constanlty gets in his way. Doesn't like to be challenged intellectually. Part of SFU's old boys club establishment.
i think he's a funny prof, sometimes will joke. his midterms and final exam are ok, not too difficult, i think. he reviews and does lots of applications to get u to know the material. not a bad prof.

Super hard, Quite cold and unhelpful, he doesn't answer question during his office hours but encourage us to go to his office hours, which is ironic. My tutor can explain things more clear than he does. Lectures are unorganized. Sometimes he is rude.
very hard, makes up stupid jokes dat arent funny at all. exams are ridiculous. he doesnt even know how to do the exams
boo-urns, avoid his classes at all costs

Very picky and easily irritated. VERY hard marker - first assignment he lowers your score by half by subtracting your wrong answers to your right answers and the whole semester you're second guessing whether or not your know what you're doing.

Worst professor I've ever had!  Aside from the barrage of horrible jokes that will leave you numb, his teaching style is extremely unhelpful.  Oh, and he's an arrogant ****, who refuses to admit when's he wrong.  Rapidly becoming senile.
super hard; even the students major in ling cant do his ling 110 hw; no notes in class at all; pretend to be funny, but not funny at all!!!
Great teaching.Good professor.It will be easier if he put up a lot of practice on the web.If u pay attention to everything he says,u r in good shape.
midterms are fair but his final is nothing like the midterms and will eat you alive.he cracks stupid jokes.

Not an easy course, not the mosy interesting lectures (for what should be pretty interesting subject matter). Not helpful when seeking help. But definately a nice, and friendly guy. Cracks a lot of stillborn jokes in class. Could/Should be a good prof.
he's a funny man
No Comments

Can't believe Paul passed away. He was one of the kindest, most reasonable professors I have had at SFU. When I needed help and went to his office hours, he was approachable and helped me with the course's homework. His death is such a shock to me, but I know he will be missed by many.
Lectures were pretty interesting, though you could learn all of it from the book. Would sometimes go off on a tangent, which made things interesting and gave nice background to some stuff.
Lectures are USELESS. Professor talks in a monotone, but the exams are SUPER easy. If you can cope with learning the subject alone, take this course. If not, please avoid.

Incredibly easy course. Read the textbook, no need to go to lecture. You can find old midterms online and they're almost exactly the same. Easy to get 100% on the midterm, although the final is a lot harder and a little less obvious. Not a difficult A- to achieve though.

Lectures are horribly boring and useless, dont bother attending. The class is ok I just became very bored and uninterested because it got very boring. Read the text and you should do ok. Final is way easier then the midterm
HE IS VERY NICE :)

The textbook (written by Dr. McFetridge) is very easy to read, though the 4 chapters were not explicitly examinable. The exams and assignments were very straightforward. It is easy to get a good grade in this course, but near impossible to get an A+ (no one got an A+ this semester), which required over 98% in the course.

Final was easier than midterm, so I don't know where to begin. This has been regarded as an "easy course", which it very well may be by a lot of people, but you still need to memorize a number of rules (which won't really help you anywhere else) to pass his exams.

There is such things as being too clear. The textbook, slides and lectures were all the same (seeing as he wrote the textbook). The lectures were really dry and it was hard to keep focused. There's an old midterm of his floating around the internet somewhere that was really useful for studying.
Lectures are mandatory since it is related to exam.  Very clear professor if you attend class.
super boring class, not many students went to the class after the second week. His slides are from his text book, so just read the text and memorize few points and you can do well in this course

Lectures were really boring, slept through most of them. The textbook (written by him) is boring too, but the course is really easy. Just write down all the rules and go over previous midterms/finals (use google).

His lectures are really dry, but he did admit he had a monotonous tone.  But, honestly, both his midterms and final exam was easy (given you've studied).  If you're good with words and rules, and memorizing it (sort of like math formulas), you'll find this course super easy.  Lectures are not mandatory, but read the book! He wrote it and it's good!
A very nice and cute guy. Although his class is boring, the exam is very easy. The textbook is helpful!
He doesn't speak clearly.
I nv went to lectures either...you'll just fall asleep or walk out like most ppl did if u go. Just read, or try to read the textbook..which is written in the same dry way he talks o_____O

honestly...he's really boring. i admit i skipped 90% of the entire semester. however i rocked the final so i got a B. if u missed class, his lecture notes won't help. his textbook however is AMAZING. seriously, i don't think i could've gotten that mark if it wasnt for the textbook. but do read carefully cuz its ALOT of readings!! have fun !!

Boring all the time. Attending the lecture is not useful. The ONLY thing you can do is trying to memorizing all the stuff in the textbook. Moreover, the textbook is complex and not logical. Good luck!

Useless professor, rambles during class. Lectures consist of examples straight out of the textbook. Gives NO indication as to what will be covered on the midterm other than a vague 20 min review consisting of him breaking down the structure of one word. GPA booster only for those with access to previous exams. WORST PROF  EVER.

not as easy as ppl will have you believe, comes late to class and jus does examples all class really, no class structure at all, final is like a page long thats it, the midterm is as long as the final

Not as simple as others said. So do not under estimate it. You still need to read the textbook and memorize a lot of stuff. The prof. is not clear at all and he never directly answer the question, not helpful at all. But if you can memorize all the stuff in the textbook, you will be fine.

Contrary to the commenter below, I found the course fairly easy.  You have to study, keep on top of readings, etc., and if you do, you'll be fine.  His exams are v. short, v. simple, and be sure to print off the assignments before they're due and look up the answers in the dictionary :)

People said Ling110 is an easy course, but my friends and I (about 10 of us) find that it's not that easy at all. (We suspected that there might be a change in course content) Plus, his lectures 3 days a week are pretty bored...he has a monotone...
No Comments
pretty good prof. easy class. not a lot of workload. definitely a gpa booster course to take. the material is very interesting too.
very easy course.. go to lecture.. don't need to read the text
He is a great guy with lots of knowledge about ling....bring a pillow to class....but your pillow needs a pillow!

Easiest course ever.. All you need is his past exam, which he used to post many versions on his website, but now he only post one version.. Make sure you got hold of all his past midterms and finals before taking the course.. I got an A becoz of it.. almost identical questions from previous exam..
No Comments

Lectures are exact copies of the courseware, so if you miss a lecture its not a big deal.  Midterm was pretty easy as well as assignments, but final was pretty hard.  Don't bother asking him a question though, because he won't really answer it.

there's no point going to the lectures, cuz what he goes through is in the courseware pack. he's boring. the assignments were easy and can boost my mark, midterm was somewhat easy. but the final was hell.  the class avg was actually quite high.

well-meaning but boring. you feel bad for sleeping in his class, but you do so anyway. a bit on the disorganized side. notes aren't as useful as the custom courseware itself. posts lectures and everything online but there is a lack of review/practice material for exams.

this prof is very wise and passionate about lingustitics...lectures are quite boring, but if you actually enjoy linguistics this is a good intro. course...assignments, midterm and final is super easy...just read over notes from lectures!
although this is kinda easy course..so boring.. his voice always makes me sleep.
No need to go to lectures, even if u do, u will not understand and sleep, because he is SO BORING.
Everything have been said.  I have to agree that his voice does make you very tiring.  Slept through most of his lecture, however, I still manage a 95 going into final.

He's an intelligent and experienced professor. However,if you ask him a question, he askes you back. He doesn't give you crystal clear answers. That makes me sometimes irritated. He's knowledgeable but not very helpful.

i slept through most of his lectures (his voice has the tendency to do that btw) but managed to get above a B in everything. he is very nice and willing to help in office hours. also, his online assignments r the best!!
No need to go to lectures, even if u do, u will not understand.  All u need to do is to study past MTs 2 days b4 exam, then u will get at least 85% or above.  That's what i did. Super Easy Course!

this is a very easy course if u take it with this prof.  all i ever did was sleep in his lecture or played with my friend's laptop~ anything he says in the lecture will be in the ccw anywayz.  got good mark (went into final with over 90%).

Rather quirky and passionate--his fervour for the subject is contagious.  He is a pool of knowledge and the reason I decided to major in Ling.  He is an acquired taste, though; I'm sure plenty of students would not take to his excitable teaching style.

Easiest course ever.. All you need is the past exams which he posted on his website.. He used to posted many past exams, but now he only post one on his website. Make sure ask your friend who took his course before for the past papers. I got an A for it.
Fairly easy class.  Easy credits.  However, dont count on learning anything useful.
Good prof, very knowledgable. Unfortunately, my class in Fall 03 acted like a bunch of high schoolers and so McFetty had to babysit half the time.
No Comments

Assignments are easy and helpful for exams. Only the rules and main concepts are tested, so ignore the rest which means little studying is required but understanding is key to an A not memorizing. Must do the past exams and know the main concepts.
It's a very interesting class. The prof's textbook is really clear. And the assignments aren't too hard..good!
I never went to class and still got a decent mark. An A is impossible to get with that crazy scale of his.
fascinating topic. Interesting lectures, but if all else fails, open your text book. All you need is right there.
Skip the class, the textbook is all you need
Organizes & interesting lectures/Previous exams are given for practice
interesting class, good lecturer, wasn't as easy as I though- hard tests!
The course is easy, but the prof is the W.O.R.S.T.
No Comments
WORST COURSE EVER TAKEN
Easy course, dun bother the lecture, read the text. Needs 89% to get A-!!

One of the best Profs ever, Dr Rimrott is really a professional LING educator. The best lecture note ever, she kindly encourages all of her students join and carries all of them. Be careful don't lose any detail in her lecture notes and pay attention on her words, if you do, u don't have problems with A. If not, u will just get average score.

WORST PROF EVER! she does not test on course material. Went into the midterm feeling very prepared, studied off of her study guide, and I barely managed to pass it. Definitely would not recommend this course with her.

I really liked this course and liked her lectures. However, she explains a lot of materials, so you should have some interest in linguistics. If you wanna know something about linguistics, you can enjoy this course:)
Yourie makes a dry topic interesting! Really enjoyed his enthusiasm. LING 110 was a challenge for me but I don't regret taking it. Be ready to memorize!

Good prof with several tricks up his sleeve to help students understand the material. Lectures are posted online. Attendance isn't mandetory but recommended as he encourages questions in class. Lots to memorize and study. Exams and assignments can be tricky.
He is the best professor I have ever seen. He is not only a good teacher; but also a great personality. His class is fun and full of passion I would really recommend you to take his class.
It's a really easy course, cause once you understand it, you won't forget the material. i barely listened in class, don't need the textbook at all. just read the notes and you'll be golden

He was a really easy going lecturer in class, though he does ramble a bit. He is very easily to contact outside of class... but his answers are not very helpful (to me). Just make sure to understand and do all the practice assignments and tests.  Also very important to memorize the Latin roots and all the rules Do lots of practice
VERY GREAT PROOF AND CLEARLY LECTURES FOR US.

I took his class in my 1st semester. He was very helpful and passionate in what he was teaching! He always tried to make himself available for his students. This is one of a Great reasons why YP's class is worth to enrol!PS: From what other LING profs mentioned b4, apparently,he could speak more than 5 languages, and they're all equally fluent.

Mr. Pankratz is a nice man. He loves what he does, and he tries to share that with his students. I didn't like the fact that he took the FOUR HOUR class during the whole semester! My class was till 9:45pm and he never let us leave earlier. NEVER. The topic was too boring for me, I didn't like it.

Yourie has got to be the liveliest, most passionate professor I have ever met. His lectures are incredibly engaging and he lives for class participation. I swear the guy gets more exercise giving a lecture than running a marathon! All his running and jumping just adds to the fun and relaxed class atmosphere. Loves to talk during his office hours!
GPA booster!!! Very approachable prof. He clarifies things better in person. Class is boring with poor jokes. Easy A.

The prof has a high interest toward the subject. He went off topic sometimes. His notes are very helpful. He has 2 assignments, 1 midterm and 1 final. Everything is very related to what he taught in class. He is a good one. =)
Easy! Take it! Involves memorization, but you'll get good grade at the end!
one of the most relaxing and fun class ever. Just read over textbooks and his examples, exams are pretty straight forward.
I like him. He s a good person.

I am finding this class very hard to follow because we haven't learned how to connect all of the information that we know. He goes off on crazy tangents sometimes which I find very annoying. Overall, I regret taking this class due to the proff. and my major is LING.

One of the best profs at SFU. He's so good at teaching that I had never skipped a class. It's important that you take notes in class. As he provides you examples, write them down and practice together with the prof (don't just wait for answers.) Reading prior lectures helps a little!
Confusing Prof. Didn't expect this course the way it was, Prof didn't really help for me to get used to his class anyhow. Don't take course unless ur prepared for unexpected.

Dr. Pankratz is one of the best profs at SFU. I really enjoyed going to his class and you can see that he loves what he does. It was a pleasure to have Dr. Pankratz for this class. I admired his knowledge and helpfulness and its prof like him that give the school a good name! Ling 110 is an easy class; a good GPA booster. i got an A- :-D
DEFINATELY recommend! always jokes around in class! material is easy.  DOn't need to read the text, just make sure you go to class and take the notes! =D

Easy course. Giving away sample mid-term and sample final which are similar to mid and final (great for pratice) Although he jokes a lot during lecture ( which is sort of wasting time) , but definitely a nice prof.

gives sample midterms and sample assignments before the actual one is due. just be comfortable with those and you're good.
 he's really helpful and really good at getting back to email questions so ask him if you need help.

Easy stuff but sometimes bad explanation, not very helpful even if he has lots of office hours. well sometimes have pretty good examples, but he confuses student and not really try to explain it clearly.(or probably if you understand the way he tries to explain thing, you will get it)  Fair enough, but not the greatest prof to do Ling 110 with.

His assignments are fairly easy, but you can never be sure what grade you will get on his exams. Midterm/Final: There was no mode for our class; all the grades were spread out. The Prof is helpful, but CONFUSING at times.. ask ask clarify argue argue. The notes he posts on webct are his lectures therefore many ppl end up not coming to class.
